trans-unit.source: Sign in to the online <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the online <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click New, then click Data + Storage, and then click Azure DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click New, then click Data + Storage, and then click Azure DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Azure preview portal, highlighting the New button, Data + storage in the Create blade, and Azure DocumentDB in the Data + Storage blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Azure preview portal, highlighting the New button, Data + storage in the Create blade, and Azure DocumentDB in the Data + Storage blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New DocumentDB account blade, specify the desired configuration for the DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: In the New DocumentDB account blade, specify the desired configuration for the DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the New DocumentDB blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the New DocumentDB blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the ID box, enter a name to identify the DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: In the ID box, enter a name to identify the DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: When the ID is validated, a green check mark appears in the ID box.
trans-unit.target: When the ID is validated, a green check mark appears in the ID box.

trans-unit.source: The ID value becomes the host name within the URI.
trans-unit.target: The ID value becomes the host name within the URI.

trans-unit.source: The ID may contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and the '-' character, and must be between 3 and 50 characters.
trans-unit.target: The ID may contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and the '-' character, and must be between 3 and 50 characters.

trans-unit.source: Note that documents.azure.com is appended to the endpoint name you choose, the result of which will become your DocumentDB account endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Note that documents.azure.com is appended to the endpoint name you choose, the result of which will become your DocumentDB account endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The Account tier lens is locked because DocumentDB supports a single standard account tier. For more information, see DocumentDB pricing.
trans-unit.target: The Account tier lens is locked because DocumentDB supports a single standard account tier. For more information, see DocumentDB pricing.

trans-unit.source: In Resource group, select or create a resource group for your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: In Resource group, select or create a resource group for your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: By default, a new Resource group will be created.
trans-unit.target: By default, a new Resource group will be created.

trans-unit.source: You may, however, choose to select an existing resource group to which you would like to add your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: You may, however, choose to select an existing resource group to which you would like to add your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For Subscription, select the Azure subscription that you want to use for the DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: For Subscription, select the Azure subscription that you want to use for the DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: If your account has only one subscription, that account is selected by default.
trans-unit.target: If your account has only one subscription, that account is selected by default.

trans-unit.source: Use Location to specify the geographic location in which to host your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Use Location to specify the geographic location in which to host your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: Once the new DocumentDB account options are configured, click Create.
trans-unit.target: Once the new DocumentDB account options are configured, click Create.

trans-unit.source: It can take a few minutes for the DocumentDB account to be created.
trans-unit.target: It can take a few minutes for the DocumentDB account to be created.

trans-unit.source: To check the status, you can monitor the progress on the Startboard.
trans-unit.target: To check the status, you can monitor the progress on the Startboard.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Creating tile on the Startboard - Online database creator</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Creating tile on the Startboard - Online database creator</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Or, you can monitor your progress from the Notifications hub.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can monitor your progress from the Notifications hub.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create databases quickly - Screen shot of the Notifications hub, showing that the DocumentDB account is being created - Online database creator notification</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create databases quickly - Screen shot of the Notifications hub, showing that the DocumentDB account is being created - Online database creator notification</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Notifications hub, showing that the DocumentDB account was created successfully and deployed to a resource group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Notifications hub, showing that the DocumentDB account was created successfully and deployed to a resource group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After the DocumentDB account is created, it is ready for use with the default settings in the online portal.
trans-unit.target: After the DocumentDB account is created, it is ready for use with the default settings in the online portal.

trans-unit.source: Note that the default consistency of the DocumentDB account is set to Session.
trans-unit.target: Note that the default consistency of the DocumentDB account is set to Session.

trans-unit.source: You can adjust the default consistency setting by clicking the Default Consistency tile on the DocumentDB account blade.
trans-unit.target: You can adjust the default consistency setting by clicking the Default Consistency tile on the DocumentDB account blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Resource Group blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Resource Group blade</linkText>
